concern:
Not sure if anyone else feels this way but it can be a lonely journey in grad school especially because of the niche stresses, things we have to deal with. 

Created a group me that will hopefully foster some community for people to talk with one another and build some friendships or the very least camaraderie 

Here’s the link to join: You're invited to my new group 'Grad School Community' on GroupMe. Click here to join: https://groupme.com/join_group/86601776/iTupsbUn

dialogue_total.statement: Hello! I'm glad you're here today. Please feel free to share what's been on your mind or anything you'd like to talk about.
Hey, so I've been feeling kind of isolated in grad school lately. It's not that I don't have friends, but the challenges we face are just so specific, it sometimes feels like no one really gets it.
therapist: It sounds like you're feeling isolated because the unique challenges of grad school make it hard for others to fully understand your experience. How has this been affecting you?
It's been a bit draining, honestly. I find myself feeling more stressed and less motivated because it feels like I'm going through all these challenges alone.
That sounds really tough, feeling drained and facing these challenges without support. What might life look like if you felt more connected and supported during grad school?

I think I'd feel more at ease, kind of like a weight's been lifted. Having people who understand would mean having someone to vent to or brainstorm with, and maybe it’d be more motivating to tackle everything.

Feeling more connected and supported sounds really important for you. Based on what you've shared, possible options to explore could include reaching out to a grad school group or joining an online community. How do these options resonate with you as potential steps to feeling more at ease?

Yeah, those sound like good ideas. I've actually started a GroupMe for grad students to connect, so I'm hoping that'll help me and others find some support and camaraderie. It's just nice to have a space where people get what you’re going through.

It's wonderful that you've taken the proactive step of starting a GroupMe for grad students. That shows your initiative and desire to create a supportive community. By fostering these connections, you're giving yourself and others the chance to feel understood and uplifted. Remember, it's okay to share your experiences and reach out for support when you need it. You're doing a great job. Keep nurturing these relationships, and over time, you'll find that sense of camaraderie you're looking for. Let's aim to check in on how this new group is helping and see if there are other ways to build connections as we move forward. You've got this!
Thanks, I appreciate your encouragement. I'll definitely try to keep these connections going and see how things progress.
